intro: Pedicularis chumbica, commonly known as the Himalayan lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with a distinctive spurred structure that attracts specific pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
